movies.title: Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers
movies.originalTitle: Zero Woman III: Keishichô 0-ka no onna
movies.plot: A special agent of the Tokyo Police has been given the assignment of assassinating a group of crime bosses. Soon afterwards, she encounters the hitman the crime bosses have sent to kill her. After talking together, they discover that they are equally reluctant to carry out their assignments. They are pushed onward by their respective bosses, however, until they must both decide where their loyalties truly lie.
movies.simplePlot: A special agent of the Tokyo Police has been given the assignment of assassinating a group of crime bosses. Soon afterwards, she encounters the hitman the crime bosses have sent to kill her...

biography.bio: Kumiko Takeda was born on August 12, 1968 in Shizuoka, Japan. She is an actress, known for Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996), Close Your Eyes and Hold Me (1996) and 24 Hour Playboy (1989).
biography.name: Kumiko Takeda

biography.bio: Keiji Matsuda is an actor, known for Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996), The Stairway to the Distant Past (1995) and Metropolitan Police Branch 82 (1998).
biography.name: Keiji Matsuda

biography.bio: Tokuma Nishioka was born on October 5, 1946 in Kanagawa, Japan. He is an actor, known for Godzilla vs. King Ghidorah (1991), Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996) and Femmes en miroir (2002).
biography.name: Tokuma Nishioka

biography.bio: Marie Jinno was born on October 13, 1971 in Kanagawa, Japan. She is an actress, known for Fudoh: The New Generation (1996), Tokyo Decameron (1996) and Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996).
biography.name: Marie Jinno

biography.bio: Charlie Yutani is an actor, known for Rampo (1994) and Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996).
biography.name: Charlie Yutani

biography.bio: Mari Nishina is an actress, known for Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996).
biography.name: Mari Nishina

biography.bio: Miyuki Tanigawa is an actress, known for Fugitive Alien (1987), Tanikawa Miyuki: Kôkô kyôshi: Yogosu! (2003) and Star Force: Fugitive Alien II (1987).
biography.name: Miyuki Tanigawa

biography.bio: Steve Blum was born on April 29, 1960 in Santa Monica, California, USA as Steven Jay Blum. He is an actor and writer, known for Digimon: Digital Monsters (1999), Batman: Arkham City (2011) and The Boxtrolls (2014).
biography.name: Steve Blum

biography.bio: Brianne Brozey was born on August 25, 1963 in West Virginia, USA as Brianne Siddall. She is known for her work on Jungle Shuffle (2014), Power Rangers Time Force (2001) and Tarzan (1999). She has been married to Deven Chierighino since April 4, 1987.
biography.name: Brianne Brozey

biography.bio: Dorothy Elias-Fahn was born on March 13, 1962 in Los Angeles County, California, USA as Dorothy Ann Elias. She is known for her work on Les chevaliers magiques du clair de terre (1994), Ghost in the Shell (1995) and Digimon: The Movie (2000). She has been married to Tom Fahn since November 9, 1985.
biography.name: Dorothy Elias-Fahn

biography.bio: Bridget Hoffman was born on March 5, 1962 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Bridget Ellen Hoffman. She is known for her work on Frozen (2013), Tangled (2010) and Big Hero 6 (2014).
biography.name: Bridget Hoffman

biography.bio: Nao Ishibashi is an actress, known for Zero Woman: Assassin Lovers (1996).
biography.name: Nao Ishibashi

biography.bio: Neil Kaplan was born on March 9, 1967 in Bayonne, New Jersey, USA. He is known for his work on Transformers: Robots in Disguise (2000), Digimon: Digital Monsters (1999) and The Last of Us (2013).
biography.name: Neil Kaplan

biography.bio: Wendee Lee was born on February 20, 1960 in Los Angeles, California, USA. She is known for her work on Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust (2000), Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (1993) and Resident Evil: Damnation (2012).
biography.name: Wendee Lee

biography.bio: Mary Elizabeth McGlynn is a voice over actress, writer, singer and director. As an actress, she plays Governor Pryce in Star Wars Rebels (2014), Dr. Maheswaran in Steven Universe (2013), Valkyrie in Lego Marvel's Avengers (2016), Talis in StarCraft II: Wings of Liberty (2010), Johanna in Heroes of the Storm (2015), and Brooha in Smile PreCure! (2012). Mary Elizabeth portrayed Major Motoko Kusanagi in Ghost in the Shell 2: Innocence (2004), for which she won the American Anime Award for Best Actress. You can also hear her as the Female Crusader in Diablo III: Reaper of Souls (2014), Kurutsu in Ghost in the Shell Arise: Border 1 - Ghost Pain (2013), and Sei in Alpha Protocol (2010). Some of her other popular roles are Kurenai from Naruto (2002), Zanpakuto from Bleach (2004), Helba from .hack//SIGN (2002), Jagura from Wolf's Rain (2003) and Caroline from Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust (2000). She also portrays Zahra on Geek & Sundry's Critical Role (2015). Mary is voice directing the Tangled: The Series (2017) television series, Billy Dilley's Super-Duper Subterranean Summer (2017), Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero (2014) for Disney XD starring _Thomas Middleditch_, _Adam Devine (III)_, _Alfred Molina_ and _Larry Wilmore_ and Smile PreCure! (2012) for Saban Entertainment. She has directed the 6 Naruto movies as well as Naruto (2002), for which she received the 2008 SPJA Award for Best Director. Among her many other directing credits are Cowboy Bebop: The Movie (2001), Tenkai Knights (2013), Digimon Fusion (2013), Stitch! (2008), Marvel Disk Wars: The Avengers (2014), Wolf's Rain (2003), and was a co-writer for the American adaptation of _Metropolis_. She also directed the original animated series Boing: The Play Ranger and_ Gormiti: The Lords of Nature Return!_. Mary Elizabeth has had the great honor of singing the music of _Akira Yamaoka_ for the movies Julia X (2011) and Silent Hill (2006) as well as the games: Silent Hill 3 (2003), Silent Hill 4: The Room (2004), Silent Hill: Origins (2007), Shadows of the Damned (2011), Silent Hill: Shattered Memories (2009) and Silent Hill: Book of Memories (2012), which she also voice directed.
biography.name: Mary Elizabeth McGlynn
